# Effects of weather events in the United States  

##Synopsis  
  
This report aims to identify the weather events in the United States that are most harmful with respect to population health and have the greatest economic consequences.   To identify these items, data from the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administrations's (NOAA) storm database is used.  The data tracks characteristics of major storms and weather events in the U.S. including date, location, fatalities, injuries, and property damage.
